review: It's probably the best way to watch videos from the internet on the big screen. Not only is it incredibly easy and intuitive to have your smartphone as a remote (a TRUE 21st century remote, not the crappy IR stuff found on the HTC One and Galaxy S4), it's also the cheapest "box" to get Netflix on your TV.I have to knock off a star because of the lag when mirroring tabs in Chrome. It's pretty much useless because of the audio delay, and it doesn't have too many uses besides that. It also is only 2.4GHz 802.11n. I guess that is just leaving room for improvement on Gen2.It'll be nice if they can make a way to let me use my phone as a remote to play videos to the Chromecast FROM my Windows PC. That would make this a $35 HTPC.It's a no-brainer product though. It's seriously great and I think eventually this is how we will watch TV in the future. There's not a single set-top box whose interface is as intuitive as a smartphone app. They just need to work on the lag (both the mirroring and loading apps and videos) and the cohesiveness before you cancel your cable.
